{{Attending Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Margaret Campbell |status = Alive |alias = *Dinosaur *Her Highness *Ye Olde Timey |title = M.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Surgeons|F.A.C.S.]] |job = '''Former'''
[[Attending]] [[General Surgery|General Surgeon]] |workplace = '''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |only appearance = [[An Honest Mistake]] |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Faye Dunaway]] }}'''Margaret Campbell''' was the first female [[General Surgery|surgeon]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. Margaret did an open cholecystectomy on [[John Terzian]]. Five days later, he came back to the ER after falling down the stairs when his incision hadn't healed as quickly as he wanted. A CT revealed that Campbell had nicked the bile duct. Despite this mistake, John asked that Campbell do the repair herself. In surgery, she quizzed Cristina, who believed she was a dinosaur who had no business operating anymore. When Cristina offended her, Campbell kicked her out of the OR. After the surgery, Owen talked to her about being discharged from the Army, saying the Army knew it was his time even though he didn't. She later said she had decided that John's surgery would be her last. [[Cristina Yang]] Margaret and Cristina Yang have a mutual dislike for each other. Dr. Campbell was Seattle Grace's first female [[General Surgery|surgeon]] and the surgical generation above that of [[Richard Webber]] and [[Ellis Grey]]. [[Callie Torres|Callie]] describes her job as "mostly she just sits around in her office and spreads prestige around, but she still does routine surgery now and then." She identifies herself as a God with a scalpel. It was hinted that she taught Richard Webber and it has been years since he's been in her OR, and does not let him forget the time he dropped a clamp into an open body cavity. She worked with Ellis Grey, as is documented in [[Ellis Grey's Journals|her journal]], March rd , where Ellis assisted her on a splenectomy (surgical removal of a spleen), and is described as "impressive r\uesum\ue, adequate technique". Cristina calls her "a dinosaur that refuses to retire her scalpel" after she does not use laparoscopic methods for a cholecystectomy on her patient, [[John Terzian]], who developed a post-operative infection, severe enough that Callie believe the infection is the reason Mr. Terzian collapsed. On a the [[Computed Tomography|CT]] scan, Cristina and Owen find a lacerated bowel duct and artery from her surgery; a mistake that should not have been made, open surgery or not. As one of the most senior [[Surgery#Surgical Specialties|surgical]] [[Attending|attendings]] at Seattle Grace, she outranks [[Owen Hunt]] and he is forced to defend her choice of open surgery instead of minimally invasive surgery when explaining the problem to the patient, in contrast to Cristina's criticism of Dr. Campbell's choice of procedure. During surgery, she teaches Cristina, after criticizing the new teaching methods of inspiration, using the her methods of fear and shame she was taught with, asking Cristina how to perform a pulmonary embolectomy (removing a clot in the pulmonary vessels). Cristina correctly and accurately describes the procedure using "newer" methods (inserting a steel wire catheter into the femoral vein and removing the clot using a fluoroscope for guidance by placing the scope adjacent to the embolism), to which Dr. Campbell retorts with a power failure, or a hospital without a fluoroscope, leaving Yang speechless, and Dr. Campbell makes her point using an analogy of teaching mental arithmetic to young children and the use of calculators. Cristina fights back by with "If it will help them to to avoid mistakes like this one", infuriating Dr. Campbell and being kicked out of the [[Operating Room|OR]]. Following the surgery to repair her original botched procedure, Owen confides that he was discharged from the army because they knew it was his time, and this prompts Dr. Campbell to retire because Richard is reluctant to fire her. And it is while she decides to retire is when Yang finally has an answer for her, using old-fashioned manual removal methods to remove an embolus. Dr. Campbell commends her, for finding her and for giving the correct answer, leading her to conclude she will be a much better surgeon than she initially thought, pleasing Cristina. *When Faye Dunaway was cast, she learned her procedure by heart so she could probably perform the procedure in reality with enough practice and equipment. *Dr. Campbell has been the only non-regular character featured as a staff [[General Surgery|general surgeon]] in\ua[[Grey's Anatomy]]. x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg [[de:Margaret Campbell]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Campbell, Margaret}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:GA S Characters]]

'''Marge Walker''' is a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Marge got a bug bite that got infected. She waited four months to go to the hospital because she\us afraid of hospitals. She repeatedly tried to leave when they mentioned needing to treat her.

To help with the anxiety, Meredith gave her a sleep mask and talked to her about Halloween. Marge told her that all the kids in her neighborhood have grown up, but it was always fun when Philip was a child. They took her to the OR as Meredith distracted her.

While in surgery, Callie discovered that the maggots had helped minimize the infection.

After surgery, they removed all unnecessary medical equipment, had her son bring some personal effects from her home, and put a sign on the door to make her more comfortable. Callie offered to stay with her, but Marge asked if she had kids to trick or treat with, saying Callie wouldn\ut want to miss that because you only get  good Halloweens before your kids start wanting to go off with their friends.



[[Philip Walker]]
She is close with her son, Philip, who convinced her to come into the hospital despite her fear. When he was a child, she made all his Halloween costumes for him.

'''Marie Fisher''' is the mother of [[Liam Fisher]].


Marie's son, Liam, had a persistent headache and fatigue. Despite this, his parents didn't seek medical care because their religion prohibits medical intervention. David and Marie were called to the hospital when Liam showed up there and was diagnosed with a brain tumor. They explained their beliefs and signed him out against medical advice to take him home.

Later, Liam returned to the hospital. By the time his parents got to the hospital, Liam was already having the surgery. David threatened to sue, but Bailey stood by her doctors and said if they hadn't operated, they'd be having a different conversation because Liam would have died. Alex went to Marie and she more or less confirmed that she'd driven Liam to the hospital herself. David and Marie later prayed by Liam's bedside as he recovered from his surgery, which was successful.



She is married to [[David Fisher]].


She and her husband didn't seek medical care for their son, Liam, because of their religious beliefs. However, Marie secretly drove Liam to the hospital to get him care, saying God helps those who help themselves.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Fisher, Marie}}

'''Marissa McKay''' is a young golf champion who came into the hospital after a spinal injury.



Marissa is an avid golfer. She was ranked first among junior golfers.


Marissa came into the hospital with severe lower back pain, which her pediatrician had dismissed as growing pains and soreness from playing golf. However, x-rays showed a serious misalignment in her spine. [[Callie Torres]] developed a plan that would allow for more stability, increasing her chances of not becoming paralyzed. However, [[Amelia Shepherd]] developed a conflicting plan, which gave her spine less stability, but allowed more flexibility, which would allow Marissa to continue golfing. Marissa chose Amelia\us approach because she said golfing was the most important thing in her life.

Amelia proceeded with the surgery, but the defect was even worse than the scans showed, so she was forced to call Callie in to do it her way. By the time Callie arrived, Marissa had no nerve function in her spine, so Callie had to work quickly to stabilize her spine to restore function. The surgery was finished and Marissa's mother was told that she would be able to walk, even run, with physical therapy, but that she wouldn\ut golf again.

Marissa was upset because she said golf was the only thing that clicked for her. Callie told her that she would find something else that would click for her.



Marissa's mother actively encouraged her daughter's love of golf. When she found out that Marissa would never play golf again, she was upset with Amelia and Callie because her daughter was great and they were supposed to be great, too.


*Marissa was the best junior golfer in the country prior to her accident. She hadn't lost a tournament in  years prior to her injury.

{{DEFAULTSORT:McKay, Marissa}}

'''Martin Davis''' is a patient who came into the ER after driving his car into a house.



Five years before his accident, Martin was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. His wife, Sally, became his caretaker.


Sally left Martin alone while she went to shower. She said she usually hid the keys, but she must have forgotten. Martin took the keys and went out. He thought he was going to a shoe store, but he actually crashed his car into the home of [[Blair Vinson|Blair]] and [[Tom Vinson]], seriously injuring all three of them. He also totaled the car. He was taken to the ER, where he continued to resist treatment efforts, still believing he was at a shoe store.

Sally arrived at the hospital soon after and explained that Martin had Alzheimer's. He was quickly taken into surgery, where they treated his rib fractures and internal injuries. After his surgery, his wife was shocked that he was completely lucid. She believed that [[Richard Webber]] had cured his Alzheimer's. However, doubting that that was the truth, [[Amelia Shepherd]] ran some more tests and discovered that instead of Alzheimer's, Martin actually had normal-pressure hydrocephalus. She said she she could place a shunt which would drain the fluid into his abdomen, relieving the dementia.

However, after speaking to the police and discovering that the car accident he caused in his confusion killed a pregnant woman, he decided that he couldn't live with the guilt and decided not to have the surgery, meaning that the fluid would build up again and he'd go back to being confused and having no memory. He told Sally then to put him in a home and walk away. Sally sat with him as he recited the poem and started to forget words.



He is married to [[Sally Davis]]. When he proposed, he recited a poem to her. When he was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease, she became his caretaker. When he became lucid again, she was delighted and said she had missed him.


He and Sally have two kids, Lisa and Toby. Lisa had gotten married and divorced while he was not lucid and his wife told him Toby had turned it around and was in his second year at Penn State.


*He was  at the time of his car accident.
*He and his wife have a  year old cat named Heidi.
*He likes football.
*The poem he recited to his wife was ''I Arise From Dreams of Thee'' by William Cooper.

'''Martin Vance''' was the Chief of Surgery at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] in .


While she was having an interlude in an [[On-Call Room|on-call room]] with [[Richard Webber]], [[Ellis Grey]] was interrupted by a knock at the door. When she answered it, she found Martin Vance, the Chief of Surgery. He informed her that the Grey Method had been placed on the short list for the [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]] and that the board wanted to see her.



He expressed his professional admiration for what Ellis Grey had done, publishing a paper while still a resident.


He was [[Chief of Surgery]] and an [[Attending]] [[Surgery|Surgeon]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] in .


*He appeared only in flashbacks.
*A picture of him appears in [[I Walk the Line]] as part of the gallery of the hospital's past and present Chiefs of Surgery.

'''Marty''' is a friend of [[Keith Kalber]] who donated a kidney to him, the first HIV+ to HIV+ kidney transplant since the law changed.



Marty was diagnosed with HIV and spent years fighting that.


At some point, Marty's friend, Keith, went into kidney failure. As he was HIV+, nothing could be done to treat him except dialysis until a new law went into effect allowing him to receive a kidney from an HIV+ donor. Marty was a good match, so they set up for Marty to donate his kidney. However, upon hearing the potential risks to the donor, Marty briefly backed out, unbeknownst to Keith. Once he saw Keith's reaction and how good a friend he was, Marty decided that he was willing to go through with it despite the risks to himself. The kidney was successfully donated.



Keith mentioned that Marty has had many wonderful boyfriends, but isn't willing to commit.


[[Keith Kalber]]
Marty and Keith have been friends for a long time. When Keith needed a kidney transplant, Marty donated his.


*Keith was with Marty when he was diagnosed with HIV.

'''Mary Parkman''' is a patient who came into the ER with abdominal pain and learned she had intestinal roundworm.


Mary's boyfriend, [[Dennis]], made her breakfast in bed one morning. Later that day, she started having severe abdominal pain, so she went to the hospital. Her abdomen was distended and she vomited. They did a barium swallow study, which showed what looked like a bowel obstruction. They hoped it would resolve itself, but April found a worm in the vomit just as they saw a worm come through Mary's NG tube. She had intestinal roundworm and needed surgery to remove the worms. This disgusted Dennis and he made an excuse to leave. Mary was not surprised as she admitted that it was very gross. Mary's surgery was successful and she was stable and awake afterward. While she was in recovery, Dennis came back and apologized for leaving.



She is dating [[Dennis]]. They've been together for a few months, but their relationship progressed quickly. Before he messaged her, she'd been alone for six years.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Parkman, Mary}}

'''Matty''' is a child who had gallstones.


Matty and his family were going on a cruise. However, Matty had had abdominal pain for a few days off and on and it got worse, so they went to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with gallstones and an inflamed gallbladder. He was taken into surgery, which was supposed to be Stephanie's first start-to-finish surgery. The surgery was going well, but after she finished removing his gallbladder, he became tachycardic because of bleeding. She was unable to stop the bleeding, so Arizona stepped in and converted to an exploratory laparotomy, which revealed bleeding from the superior mesenteric artery from the trocar insertion. She tried to repair the tear, but she was unable to control the bleeding and Matty died in the OR.



Matty and his parents were going on a cruise. Matty was excited and so was his father.


*He was nine years old at the time of his death.
*He was the first child patient lost by [[Eliza Minnick]].

'''Maura Brooks''' is\ua[[Heather Brooks]]'s mother. She visited\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]\uaafter her daughter died during surgery.



After Heather died during surgery, Maura was called by someone at the hospital. They only told her that\ua[[Heather Brooks|Heather]]\uawas injured, because Derek wanted to tell Maura the bad news personally. As he had to go home with\ua[[Zola Grey Shepherd|Zola]], he instructed\ua[[Jo Wilson|Jo]], [[Stephanie Edwards|Stephanie]],\ua[[Shane Ross|Shane]],\uaand\ua[[Leah Murphy|Leah]]\uato wait for her arrival. He also told them to come up with Heather stories to make her mother feel like she died among friends. They couldn't come up with any, making them realize that they weren't a tight group.\uaWhile drinking some alcohol to help them come up with some stories, the interns came up with secret stories about themselves. While Stephanie was demonstrating her cheerleader dance from high school, Maura entered the intern locker room. She asks them about her daughter, Heather Brooks. The cheering and laughing interns immediately hushed.

They went to the waiting room with her, where Derek came over. He told her that her daughter died, and she broke down crying. Some time later, the inters accompanied her back to the locker room, where Maura cleaned out Heather's locker. The interns felt obligated to tell some Heather stories, so they stole Meredith's story about George. It made Maura smile, but she soon returned to crying. She saw how emotional Shane was, who secretly felt guilty. She hugged him, saying that he and Heather must've been close.

When Heather's uncle arrived at the hospital, the interns left her with him. Heather's brother was on his way to the hospital too.



She is divorced.


Maura had two children: Heather and a son, whose name is unknown. Maura also had a brother, who travelled to the hospital (just like Heather's brother) when Heather died.


*She was the first family member of one of the new interns to make an appearance.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Brooks, Maura}}

'''Maya Roberts''' is a young cancer patient who had a new set of ribs D printed for her treatment.


When Maya was about , she had a pain in her leg. It was diagnosed as chondrosarcoma, a type of bone cancer only treatable with surgery. Her right leg was amputated below the knee. Two years later, the cancer came back in her chest. She went to three different hospitals looking for a miracle and each of them told her to go to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], to [[Alex Karev]]. When she did so, Alex saw her and then consulted with [[Callie Torres]] and [[Maggie Pierce]], who told him that titanium plates to replace the ribs and sternum they'd have to remove was the tried and true method to treat the cancer.

Alex took the plan to Maya, who rejected it after hearing she'd have to have annual revision surgeries and the titanium plates were fragile, leaving her vulnerable to injury. When Alex refused to explore other, more radical options, she fired him from her case.

After firing Alex, she went to Callie and Maggie directly, asking them for other choices. They determined that they could remove her cancer and then replace her ribs and sternum with a D printed version made specifically for her body. Maya accepted the plan despite the risks. Her mother was initially worried, but signed the consent when Maya asked her to.

Before her surgery, Alex came to hold her hand. Once in the OR, she started to get worried and told Alex she didn't want to die. He told her she wouldn't, but she made him promise to tell her mom there was an envelope under her bed with bank statements and the deed to their house and to keep her mother company while she was in surgery if he could.

As they went to place the new ribs, they found that it didn't quite fit, despite being custom-made. In order to finish the procedure, they decided to pull on Maya's ribs to separate them and give them the room they needed to place the new ribs. It was successful and Maya was stable and awake after her surgery.



Maya was raised by a single mother who was young when she was born. Maya took charge in her own medical care because her mother never really understood anything about it and said Maya had a mind for it.


*She was  at the time of her second resection.

'''Melissa''' was at patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who had severe crush injuries.



Melissa was riding her bike when she was hit by a car and trapped underneath it. Meredith Grey was driving by there on her way to work and stopped to help. When she found that Melissa was conscious and having trouble breathing, she convinced several bystanders to work together to lift the car. Once the car was up, Meredith pulled Melissa out from underneath it and Melissa started to breathe again.

Meredith rode with Melissa in the ambulance and took her right into surgery. She was bleeding heavily and had a femur break near her femoral artery. Her blood volume had been replaced completely four times. They reached a point of diminishing returns, so they packed her and took her to the ICU.

The next morning, her lung collapsed and they had to put in a chest tube. Later that day, Meredith decided it was time to go back in. They were able to stop the bleeding and Melissa woke up in the ICU after surgery and asked for Meredith. She remembered her as the woman who saved her life.



After her accident, her parents were called and were going to come from Toronto.

{{Patient Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Melissa |status = Alive |diagnosis = *Lacerations *Contusions *Open tibia fracture *Internal bleeding |doctors = *[[Owen Hunt]] *[[Callie Torres]] *[[April Kepner]] *[[Jo Wilson]] |treatment = *Laparotomy *Tibia repair |marital = Ex-fianc\ue |job = *Private First Class *Computer repairperson |workplace = '''Current'''
Office Hub
'''Former'''
US Army |only appearance = [[Don't Let's Start]] |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Meg Steedle]] }} '''Melissa''' is an Army veteran who was brought into the hospital after being carjacked. During the war in Iraq, Melissa worked repairing computers in the Green Zone. Because she wasn't in combat areas, when she returned to the US, she was reluctant to take advantage of services meant to help veterans, feeling that it would take them away from soldiers who were injured during their service. However, after her surgery, Owen talked to her and convinced her that she had given what she was able to give, but had still served her country, meaning she was entitled to the same services as those who had served in combat. He also encouraged her to volunteer, working to help other veterans, but told her that she needed to get back on her own feet before she could do that. When Melissa returned to the US after serving in Iraq, she found that the job she had lined up was gone and her fianc\ue, as well as the apartment they shared, was gone as well. She was only able to find work at Office Hub, but it didn't pay well enough to afford rent, so she began living out of her car. One day, while she was sleeping, carjackers broke her window and tried to pull her out of the car. She tried to hang on as long as she could and was dragged by the car for a while. But the carjackers punched and kicked her until she couldn't hold on any longer. She was found by a co-worker, [[Keith (Don't Let's Start)|Keith]], on his way into work. He called an ambulance and she was taken to the ER. At the hospital, she was taken into a trauma room, where they had to perform an emergency laparotomy as they didn't have time to take her to an OR. Once they had packed her abdomen, she was taken to the OR, where her internal injuries were repaired and her leg fracture was cleaned out. Her tibia repair was scheduled for the following day. When she woke after her first surgery, she was concerned about her car. The police said they found the pieces of it in a chop shop, which was devastating for her as the car was all she had. It held all of her belongings and her clothes, as well as all her savings and her insurance paperwork. Her tibia repair went well, but afterward, the doctors talked to her about her homelessness and offered to set her up with services for homeless veterans. She declined their offers and asked them not to say anything to her co-workers, who had come to her hospital room to see her. Owen later came into her room with pamphlets for the programs, pulling rank on her to force her to listen to him before explaining to her why she had the right to them as much as any other veteran. Melissa was engaged. However, when she finished her service in the Army, she came back to find that her fianc\ue had left her. Her co-workers, [[Keith (Don't Let's Start)|Keith]], [[Jacki]], and [[Caroline]], came to visit her in the hospital, despite professing that they don't know her that well. Keith is the one who found her after the carjacking. Melissa worked on computers in Iraq during Operation Iraqi Freedom, from -. After she was finished with her service, she had a job lined up back in the US, but that didn't pan out, so she began working at Office Hub, which didn't pay well. *She was in her s when she was carjacked. *She has a tattoo on her leg that reads, "OIF -" in honor of her time spent working with the Army during Operation Iraqi Freedom. x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{DISPLAYTITLE:Melissa}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Ortho)]]

'''Mia James''' came to the ER after she was in a car accident with her mother and brother.


Mia was riding in a car with her brother and their mother when their mother started crashing into other cars before driving off a bridge into the water. The three of them were pulled from the water and taken to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Mia had a facial laceration which required stitches, but was otherwise okay, while Brooke had a perforation of her duodenum and was taken directly into surgery. While they were operating, [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] thought of alternatives to why Brooke might have driven off the bridge other than just snapping under the pressure. She suggested an insulinoma, a tumor on the pancreas which would cause an extra secretion of insulin, which explained all her symptoms, including the low blood sugar she had in the ER. They did a trauma whipple to repair the other damage while pathology reviewed her scans, looking for the tumor. They came up with nothing, but Meredith was still convinced it was there, so she looked by hand. It was small, about the size of the head of a pin, but it was there. They removed it and in recovery, they told her husband that all her symptoms, the fatigue, irritability, and stress, were all due to the tumor and now that they had removed it, she'd make a full recovery.



Mia lives with her parents and her brother, Parker. Her mother works hard to take care of her and her brother, which is why it was shocking when she drove off a bridge with the kids in the car.


*She was ten at the time of her hospitalization.
*Her father mentioned that violin and baseball are his kids' hobbies, but it's unknown which kid does what exactly.

'''Micah''' came into the ER after falling off a ski lift.



When Karen, Micah's mom, started dating Brian, Danielle's dad, the kids did not approve. Brian even waited three years to propose because of the conflict within their family.


In an attempt to resolve the conflict within their family, Brian planned a ski trip for them. While they were riding the ski lift to the top of the hill, Brian with Micah and Karen with Danielle, the earthquake hit. Micah fell and Brian fell with him after trying to stop him. Brian had only minor injuries, but Micah broke his leg and had abdominal pain. Tests revealed that Brian's injuries required no further testing, but Micah was taken for a CT. The CT revealed a grade IV splenic laceration, so they planned surgery, but before he could be taken, he coded in the room. They were able to resuscitate him and get him to an OR, where they removed his spleen and repaired his other injuries.

After surgery, Micah was stable.



Micah has a single mom, Karen. Karen got engaged to Brian, whom Micah doesn't seem to like. Brian also has a daughter, Danielle, who thinks Micah's a dweeb.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He didn't want to go on the ski trip.

'''Micah''' is the landlord of the building that collapsed.


Micah was injured when the building he owns collapsed. At the hospital, he believed he was dying and asked for a priest to talk to. When one wasn't available, he instead confessed to Ben that he knew the building wasn't sound and begged Ben to forgive him for killing all the people. He had been told there was damage after an earthquake, but he didn't have the money for the repairs. He couldn't raise rent because many of his tenants were barely able to pay him as it was.

After confessing, he had a seizure and was sedated. He was taken for a CT and then into surgery. After surgery, he was taken to ICU, where he waited. [[Carolyn Adkins]], one of his tenants whose daughter, [[Winnie Adkins]], had died as a result of the collapse, came into his room and tried to kill him by disconnecting his vent. However, she was restrained and arrested before she could complete her attempt.



He has a good relationship with his tenants and has known many of the children since their parents brought them home from the hospital.


He is the landlord of an apartment building that collapsed.

'''Michael''' is a patient who was brain dead following an accident whose husband had a hard time letting him go.


While they were heading to the grocery store, Michael and his husband Sam were in a car accident. Michael was traumatically injured in the accident. First, his heart ruptured and they repaired that. But the next day, his lungs collapsed. By Thursday, his kidneys failed. The sepsis and infection took three more days to kill his brain, leaving him brain dead.

After Michael was declared brain dead, his husband, Sam, signed the papers to turn off the machines. As the machines were being turned off, Sam changed his mind, so the machines were turned back on. [[Owen Hunt|Owen]] assigned Cristina to stay with the Sam and make him understand that turning off the machines it the best course of action. [[Emily Kovach]] offered her help, saying she was there when the couple came in and had gotten to know Sam.

Cristina showed Sam a scan of a patient in a coma who was not brain dead and compared it to Michael's, saying that they hadn't seen any brain function from Michael in three days.

Later, Cristina came in and explained how Michael had died in slow motion. If he had died immediately after the crash, he'd be just as dead, but Sam wouldn't be feeling the way he was. He would have the comfort of knowing that Michael was dead.

Sam asked Cristina to bring him the papers, which he signed. Then he sat with his husband while he died, telling him that he was scared to lose Michael.



He had been with his husband, [[Sam (One Step Too Far)|Sam]], for  years at the time of his death.

She was rushed to the ER, where they diagnosed several fractures as well as internal injuries. She was rushed into surgery, where they had to remove a portion of her intestine. However, before her surgery could be completed, she had signs that there was no brain activity. Michael believed she wouldn't want to live like that, but her parents wanted the doctors to do whatever they could to keep her alive. They were given pamphlets for several long-term care facilities.

'''Michael Whitman''' came into the hospital after passing out during dinner with his daughter.


While having dinner with his daughter, Beth, Michael passed out. At the hospital, he insisted that it was probably just because of his hernia, but they said his hernia didn't seem to be the cause of the obstruction. Once his daughter was out of the room, he told them he was diagnosed with colorectal cancer. He'd had five polyps removed in the last three years and radiation. He hadn't told Beth and didn't want to tell her. They ran a CT and got his medical records sent over. He started coughing up blood and had to be rushed into surgery. In surgery, they found a tumor, meaning he'd need more aggressive treatment. After his surgery, Beth was told he'd be awake in a few hours and despite Michael's insistence that she might be told, Owen told her the the had colorectal cancer.



He was married until his wife died when his daughter was young.


After his wife died, he spoiled his daughter, Beth, believing that losing her mother so young was enough pain for a lifetime. When he was diagnosed with cancer, he hid that information from her.

'''Mickey Wenschler''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] and one of the participants in [[Callie Torres|Callie]] and [[Derek Shepherd|Derek's]] brain mapping trial.



Mickey was drunk and caused an accident which killed two teenage girls, named Lindsay and Cheryl, and left him paralyzed from the neck down.


Feeling guilty about having killed two teenage girls and then having to have people take care of him around the clock, Mickey signed up for [[Callie Torres|Callie]] and [[Derek Shepherd|Derek's]] brain mapping trial, seeing it as a way to help other people. The sensors were successfully implanted and he was able to control the computer with his mind, using it to control a digital hand and play a computer game.


Mickey's progress in the trial was halted when it was discovered that he had low activity in his temporal lobe due to a brain tumor. It went into the brain stem, meaning that neither embolization glue nor removal was an option. He asked Derek to allow him to continue the trial, but Derek declined, saying that the tumor could affect the results and bias the trial and that it couldn't be removed. Mickey then declined consent for Derek to remove the sensors unless he also agreed to remove the tumor. Since Callie had a previous relationship with Mickey as he was originally her patient, Derek asked her to talk to Mickey and convince him to let Derek remove the sensors.

When Callie went to Mickey, he told her the story of how he became paralyzed. He told her about how he wanted to do the trial so that he could help other people and feel like less of a burden. She went back and convinced Derek to try to remove the tumor.

Derek operated, but Mickey was pronounced brain dead in the OR. However, Derek and Callie later harvested his brain to help them in their research.

'''Mike Zicaro''' came into the ER with his brother, Dominic, who had his hand stuck in a meat grinder.


While grinding meat, Mike's brother, Dominic, got his hand stuck in the meat grinder. [[Callie Torres|Callie]] had [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] take the lead on the case, making the decisions for Dominic's care. Meredith initially believed they should amputate, but when she found a viable finger, she changed her mind and they made steps to save his hand. When they talked about cutting through the grinder to free his hand, his brothers objected, saying it was expensive. They said they had to take it apart every night to clean it anyway, so Callie let them take it apart to free Dominic's hand. To buy Dominic more time, they applied a tourniquet above the grinder.

Once they got it apart, Callie told his brothers to leave while they turned back the auger and released Dominic's hand. They didn't leave right away and when his hand was pulled out, they both passed out on the floor. His hand was severely injured and only two of his fingers were left attached. While Meredith and Callie were in the OR working on Dominic's hand, Meredith determined that one of his amputated fingers was still viable and could be reattached, but Callie said the thumb wasn't, so Dominic would be better off with a prosthetic as the thumb is responsible for % of hand function. Meredith suggested that they take his big toe to replace his thumb, but Callie said that his big toe is too important for his balance, so they'd take the second toe instead. They closed and went to get Dominic's consent.

Dominic's brothers thought it was weird, but Dominic agreed to the surgery. They took him back in and retrieved his second toe and attached it in place of his lost thumb.



Mike owns a butcher shop with his two brothers, Dominic and Tommy. When Dominic got his hand stuck in a meat grinder, Mike and Tommy took it apart to free his hand.


Mike owns a butcher shop with his brothers, Tommy and Dominic.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Zicaro, Mike}}

'''Mindy Wallace''' is a pregnant woman who was in a car accident on the way to the hospital while in labor.


Mindy went into labor. Since her husband, Bryan, was out shopping, she called a taxi. [[Steve Duncan]] came and told her to get in the front seat so she could recline. He then started a video chat with the hospital so he could give them information as he drove to the hospital. When they were only a few blocks away, Arizona told Mindy to put her legs up when she felt the baby descend so she'd be more comfortable. Shortly after that, they were hit by another car.

The doctors rushed out to the car to get Mindy into the hospital. In the ER, she had a strong fetal heartbeat, but an x-ray showed that both her hips were dislocated and broken, forcing the bones upward into her chest and abdomen, a result of having her feet up on the dashboard. She was taken for a CT, which showed a splenic laceration and internal bleeding. She was rushed into an emergency surgery, first to deliver the baby and then to repair her injuries. She asked if her husband could be there for the birth, since she was going to be unconscious herself. Arizona agreed, but said he'd need to leave immediately after the birth. Before she was anesthetized, Mindy noticed the scratches on her husband's face and against Arizona's advice, he revealed he was the one who had hit her on his way to the hospital.

Once Mindy was out, the baby was delivered and didn't breathe right away. They determined that she had a diaphragmatic hernia. Arizona had to leave Mindy's surgery to operate on the baby. Maggie finished her surgery and her husband was told she was alive, but still not out of the woods. Their daughter's surgery went well and Bryan was told she'd be okay.



She is married to [[Bryan Wallace]].


She and her husband have a daughter.

'''Mitchell Spencer''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Mitchell was assigned to [[Stephanie Edwards]] on the first day of his internship. He followed her and observed. He was then asked to take [[Joan Paulson]] up for surgery. He unintentionally upset Joan by talking with another intern about how Joan's fianc\ue, [[Keith Gardner]], had been trapped in a car and they'd have to give up on saving him. When she panicked, she said she couldn't breathe. Mitchell thought it was because of the collar she was in, so he loosened it slightly, which caused Joan's neck to dislocate. Stephanie was able to save Joan from paralysis by acting quickly to stabilize her neck. ''("[[Time Stops]]")''

When the doctors realized they would have very little time to get [[Keith Gardner]] to an OR before he bled to death, Mitchell, along with the other interns, was posted along the path to clear the way. Mitchell and the group then rounded out their first day by rounding on [[Joan Paulson]], who was stable and expected to make a full recovery. ''("[[You're My Home]]")''


Mitchell was in the ER when [[Jessica Tanner]] and [[Aliyah Hamed]] came in after their attempted joint suicide. He was shocked to see Aliyah's foot completely turned around and called for help, saying he wasn't sure what to do. ''("[[Sledgehammer]]")''


While attending a session of the [[Anatomy Classes|anatomy class]] taught by [[Richard Webber]], Mitchell had to leave the room to vomit when Richard talked about brains decomposing. He later went back to the lab and cut a brain into slices. ''("[[Old Time Rock and Roll]]")''


Seeing that the interns weren't well-trained in delivering bad news to patient families, [[Owen Hunt]] insisted that they all be trained. He taught them the four Ls (Location, language, body language, and leave) and informed them that they'd be telling the families of the people who died in the ER that day. ''("[[Old Time Rock and Roll]]")''


Mitchell went with Ben when surgery was paged to consult on a psych patient. He was horrified when they arrived and the patient had no pulse and psych had no equipment to open him. He wanted to page an attending, but Ben said he'd open him up and sent Mitchell to get an open chest tray. Mitchell left and came back with [[Richard Webber]], who was startled and angry to see that Ben had used a clipboard to open the patient's chest. They then took the patient into surgery to repair his abdominal aortic aneurysm. ''("[[All Eyez on Me]]")''


Mitchell is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. He joined the program for the - [[Resident|residency]] year, and was assigned to [[Stephanie Edwards]].

'''Monica McKeever''' was hospitalized when, while she was having sex in a car, a gurney was blown off the roof and crashed into the car.


While having sex with her boyfriend outside the hospital, Monica was injured when a gurney was blown off the roof and crashed into the car through the sunroof. While they were waiting for Fire and Rescue to free them from the car, Dave noticed that Monica was bleeding heavily from her head. They finally freed her from the car and she was loaded onto a gurney to be taken into the hospital.

In the ER, [[Jo Wilson]] examined her head. She told Monica that in order to examine her properly, she might have to shave part of Monica's head. Monica, who had been wanting to shave her head in solidarity with her boyfriend [[David Oldroyd|Dave]] since he went bald due to his chemotherapy, was excited and told Jo to shave it all off. Once her head was shaved, Jo told her that one of the lacerations on her head would need stitches. However, before Jo could do that, Monica became unresponsive.

Monica was taken into surgery with a brain bleed. Her surgery went well and she woke up afterward.



Monica is dating [[David Oldroyd]]. Dave was diagnosed with stage  osteosarcoma. The treatment for the condition made him lose his hair. Monica tried to shave her head in solidarity, but he didn't let her. Later, while visiting Dave on the day he was meant to have chemotherapy, they had sex in her parents' car. While they were having sex, a gurney was blown off the roof and impaled her car, injuring both of them. Her injuries necessitated her head being shaved, which she loved and she believed Dave would love as well. After she had to have emergency surgery, she woke up and she and Dave shared a kiss.


Monica's father was transferred to Portland. So when Dave was having chemo, Monica took her parents' car without their knowledge and used it to drive back to Seattle to see him. When Monica was injured in the hospital parking lot, her parents were notified and they got on a plane to come see her.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Monica Zarr''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Monica was diagnosed with rectal cancer. She had a bowel resection to treat it and was in remission, but she was left with poor sphincter control.


Once in remission, Monica planned a grand return to the stage. During rehearsals, she was able to get through it with frequent trips to the bathroom. However, on the first full run-through, she wasn't able to escape to the bathroom and she pooped on stage in the middle of a dance. She was humiliated and stopped dancing.


Dr. Webber inserted a sacral nerve stimulator to reduce the frequency of Monica's bowel movements. However, it didn't work as well as he hoped and he decided to remove it.


Inspired by a similar procedure done at the base of the esophagus to reduce acid reflux, Dr. Murphy suggested they insert a magnetic sphincter to control Monica's bowels. Both Paul and Monica were excited to hear about the device and agreed to the surgery. The device was inserted successfully.



[[Paul Zarr]]
Monica is married to Paul Zarr.


Monica is a professional dancer. She had to quit dancing while being treated for cancer. When she was in remission, she attempted a grand return to the stage, but during the first full run-through, without the ability to run to the bathroom frequently, Monica had a humiliating experience when she pooped in the middle of a dance.


*Before her magnetic sphincter was implanted, she was pooping every  hours and  minutes.

'''Mr. Crossley''' is the husband of [[Mrs. Crossley]], a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].


Mr. Crossley's wife was in the hospital to receive a pacemaker to treat a complete heart block. It was a simple procedure and she was scheduled to be able to go home that evening. Her surgery went well, but after she was discharged, her husband brought her back in, dangling her by her ankles, because every time he put her down, her heart stopped. A lead in her pacemaker had become disconnected when she coughed and she had to be taken into the OR to have it reconnected. In a race to be chosen to scrub in over [[Stephanie Edwards]], [[Leah Murphy]] accidentally connected Mrs. Crossley's oxygen to her IV, a potentially fatal mistake. However, the mistake was quickly rectified and Mrs. Crossley was fine.



Mr. Crossley is married to [[Mrs. Crossley]].


*He is deaf in one ear.

'''Mr. Kramer''' is the father of [[Susie Kramer]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


His daughter, Susie, had taken off her helmet while riding her ATV for just a second to take a picture and was hit. She was taken to the hospital with an open depressed skull fracture. They attempted to do a -second scan, but there was too much bleeding and she was taken directly to the OR.

While in surgery, Derek discovered that her injuries were even more severe than suspected and they'd be in there longer than they anticipated.

She survived the surgery, but until she woke up, they wouldn't know how much long-term damage she would have. When Shane and Derek went to tell her father, he attacked them and had to be subdued.



He is very protective of his daughter, [[Susie Kramer|Susie]]. He took her riding ATVs every weekend starting when she was .

When their son contracted an aggressive infection after having surgery, Mr. and Bess Lepik came to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] to be with him. They immediately demanded that he be moved to another hospital for treatment. However, before the move could happen, [[Richard Webber]] determined that Seth needed to go back into surgery. They reluctantly agreed to allow him to operate. However, in surgery, Seth died. The infection was later traced back to the gloves used during his first surgery.



He is married to [[Bess Lepik]]. Together, they have a son.


His son, Seth, contracted MRSA after having surgery at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. He later died of complications from that infection in surgery.

She came into the hospital immediately. She scolded Dave for sneaking out of the hospital, saying that he was supposed to be resting before his chemo, not having sex with his girlfriend. She continued to disapprove of Dave and Monica's flirting.

When Monica had to be taken into emergency surgery to treat a brain bleed, Mrs. Oldroyd was concerned about her and comforted her son, who was also worried.



Her son, Dave, was diagnosed with stage  osteosarcoma. He was being treated at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. The day he was supposed to receive chemo, he sneaked out of the hospital with his girlfriend to have sex in her parents' car. When his mother discovered what had happened, she was disappointed in him. However, when Monica was taken into emergency surgery, she comforted her son.

'''Mrs. Rodriguez'''\uais [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] and [[Owen Hunt|Owen's]] dog.


Owen convinced Cristina to go to an animal shelter with him to choose a dog and Cristina chose Mrs. Rodriguez.

When Cristina was in the OR,\uaOwen came in and said he had an emergency surgery that required him to operate for  hours. She said it was okay, but he reminded her about Mrs. Rodriguez. Cristina thought Mrs. Rodriguez would last for  hours, which was when she'd be done with her surgery. They had a discussion about whether or not to lock the dog in the kitchen when they're gone until Owen left. Alex couldn't believe she got a dog, thinking it'd die within the week. Shane didn't understand why she named it Mrs. Rodriguez, but Cristina said he would once he met the dog. Alex advised him to go see the dog soon before it died. Cristina claimed she was not going to have a problem keeping an animal alive as she's a physician and assured him the dog is perfectly healthy.

Later, Owen and Cristina were having a discussion where Owen said he wanted to go to Germany and take Cristina with him.\ua"I never give you anything, so the terms under which we're together are that your dreams die!" Cristina remarked. Meanwhile, a barking Mrs. Rodriguez had come over. Owen asked her to quiet the damn dog, but she told him to do it as he wanted the dog. Owen said that the dog only liked her. "Because you make stupid decisions! And he knows it! I'm not moving to Germany!" Cristina yelled.


*Although his name is Mrs. Rodriguez, he's a male dog.
*He was named by Cristina.

'''Nancy Dawson''' is the mother of [[Paul Dawson]] and grandmother to\ua[[Ethan Dawson]].



At some point in her life, Nancy was diagnosed with cataracts.


After her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson were in an accident, Nancy came to the hospital to be with them and take care of her grandson while both of his parents were hospitalized. When Rachel, who had woken up, joked with the still unconscious Paul, Nancy started to cry, as she wasn't ready for her son to die before her. ''("[[Sleeping Monster]]")''

After Paul had been unconscious for eight days, they began to worry that he'd never wake up. While she was napping at her hotel, Ethan took an overdose of her sleeping pills and had to be rushed back to the ER. Social services came to talk to them, but noting the unusual circumstances, they didn't take Ethan into custody. Nancy began to question if they should, however, as she is older and not fit to raise an active  year old. ''("[[Do You Believe in Magic]]")''

After nine days, Nancy talked to [[Cristina Yang]] about withdrawing care. Cristina advised her that as there had been no improvement for eight days, the neurological deficits would most likely be permanent. When a clot was discovered, she consented to a surgery that could possibly kill him. The procedure worked and Paul woke up. ''("[[Readiness is All]]")''



She is married. Her husband is in a facility and she takes the bus to see him.


She has a son, [[Paul Dawson]]. When Paul; his wife, [[Rachel Dawson|Rachel]]; and their son, [[Ethan Dawson|Ethan]] were in a car accident, Nancy flew to [[Seattle]] to see them and take care of Ethan while his parents were both hospitalized. After Rachel died and it appeared that Paul might not wake up, Nancy admitted that she wasn't fit to raise Ethan on her own. However, Paul eventually did wake up. ''("[[Readiness is All]]")''

'''Naomi''' was brought to the ER after her pet lion injured both her and her boyfriend.


Naomi decided that the time had come to introduce her boyfriend [[Paul (The Lion Sleeps Tonight)|Paul]] to her pet lion, [[Kirby]]. When Kirby started to approach Naomi, Paul panicked, which caused Kirby to attack both of them. Naomi sustained multiple bites to her neck and abdomen and needed surgery to repair her injuries.

After surgery, Paul tried to say that he had been a hero, but Naomi said that he was an idiot.



Naomi was dating Paul. They'd been dating for a while when she decided to introduce him to her pet lion. When they met, Paul panicked, which led to them both being injured and Kirby getting free. Paul thought he was a hero, but Naomi said he wasn't.


Naomi had a pet lion, [[Kirby]], whom she loved. However, after her boyfriend's panic resulted in Kirby getting loose in Seattle, Kirby was taken away from her. Naomi blamed Paul for Kirby's escape and capture.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.
*She had had Kirby for  years.

'''Natalie''' was a friend of [[Camille Travis]] who helped to put on the prom.



Natalie went to the prom, along with [[Claire (Season )|Claire]] and [[Camille Travis|Camille]]. When Camille lost consciousness at the prom, they were both concerned and came to the hospital. They then called all their friends and essentially brought the prom to the hospital. Richard sent them all away, but Adele yelled at him for sending her friends away and said he needed to make it up to Camille. ''("[[Deterioration of the Fight or Flight Response]]")''


Claire, Natalie, and the interns planned a prom for Camille and all their friends. The colors were silver and white. Richard made attendance at the prom mandatory for the hospital staff. ''("[[Losing My Religion]]")''



Natalie was one of the best friends of Camille, along with [[Claire (Season )|Claire]] who helped put on Camille's hospital prom because Camille had collapsed during her own.

'''Nate James''' is the father of [[Emery James]], who was brought into [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] after a sailing accident.



Nate's daughter, Emery, was planning to sail solo from Mexico to Alaska.


In Seattle, Emery was in a boat accident (a massive wave pushed the mast down on her leg), which resulted in her being taken to [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] with a nearly severed foot. She wasn't able to feel the foot and they weren't able to detect a pulse in it. They initially assessed that they'd have to amputate the foot, but when they told her that, she panicked and moved her foot, showing them that she still had nerve function in the foot.

Her parents were called and they were expected to arrive that evening. She was taken into surgery quickly. In surgery, they were able to restore blood flow.


While her parents were talking to the doctors, Emery was online. Someone offered to donate a new boat to her so she could complete her sail. She said if she got back out on the water within two weeks, she'd be able to do it before the weather got bad. However, [[Callie Torres|Dr. Torres]] informed her that if she wanted to get back to full function in her foot, she'd be in the hospital for a while and it would mean a series of big operations, during which she'd have to stay off her feet.

Despite her assurances to Dr. Torres that she'd stay off her feet between operations, Emery accepted a boat from a sailing company and was planning to go back out as soon as she was released from the hospital. Dr. Torres encouraged her mother to "be the bad guy" and stop her from sailing to protect her.



Nate is married to [[Hazel James]], with whom he has a daughter, [[Emery James]].


His daughter, [[Emery James]], is an avid sailer. She was attempting to sail solo from Mexico to Alaska when her boat capsized and she was injured.

{{Patient Infobox |image = xNathanGlazier.png |name = Nathan Glazier |status = Alive |diagnosis = *Hypoplastic left heart syndrome *Conduit rejection *Heart failure *Edema |doctors = *[[Cristina Yang]] *[[Alex Karev]] *[[Shane Ross]] |treatment = *Medication *Pericardiocentesis *Diuretics *Beta blockers *Seeded conduit from a D printer |parents = *[[Don Glazier]] *[[Ashley Glazier]] |first appearance = [[Two Against One]] |last appearance = [[Man on the Moon]]
[[Take It Back]] ''(photo)'' |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] }} '''Nathan Glazier''' was a patient with HLHS who received a D printed conduit. Nathan was born with hypoplastic left heart syndrome. He had a synthetic conduit placed, but his body rejected it. After his SATs fell, he was moved to the [[Pediatric Intensive Care Unit|PICU]]. His parents were told that they'd try treating his rejection with medication, but if that didn't work, they'd have to take out the conduit and place a new one. Because of the risk that he'd reject a second synthetic conduit, Shane found research from Japan in which they were D printing conduits and seeding them with the patient's own cells to remove the chance of rejection. However, Cristina rejected the idea because it was too experimental. Shane asked her to consider it if he started the ground work with the FDA. Cristina later rejected the idea outright, but Shane pressured her to reconsider. After Nathan went into heart failure, she decided to try the printing. ''("[[Two Against One]]")'' While they were waiting for his new conduit to finish printing, Nathan developed severe edema, which they treated with diuretics and beta blockers. The day he was supposed to have his conduit implanted, they discovered that it was contaminated and it would take another day to print a new one. They had to put him on an oscillator in order to give them the remaining time they needed to finish the printing. ''("[[Somebody That I Used to Know]]")'' Because of the interest in Nathan's surgery, Owen asked the Glaziers for their consent to live-stream his surgery for people to watch. They were reluctant because they wanted the focus to be on Nathan, not on putting on a show. Cristina had assured the Glaziers\uathat her focus would only be on Baby Nathan. They took Nathan into surgery, where they worked on him while his printed conduit was going through its final testing. Once the conduit was ready, she placed it. When he started to decline, Cristina instructed them to stop filming. After his surgery was completed, he was put back on the oscillator, but they said they hoped to be able to move him back to a normal ventilator if he could oxygenate. Soon after, they were able to take him off of the oscillator. The conduit was working.\ua''("[[Man on the Moon]]")'' At a press conference, Cristina discussed Nathan's case. She said he was responding well and she hoped he would continue to thrive. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]]")'' Cristina later received a picture of Nathan from his mother, home from the hospital and healthy. ''("[[Take It Back]]")'' Nathan was supposed to be the first person in his family to go to college. ''("[[Somebody That I Used to Know]]")'' *He was nine months old when his printed conduit was placed. ''("[[Man on the Moon]]")'' xNathanGlazier.png|[[Two Against One]] xNathanGlazier.png|[[Somebody That I Used to Know]] xNathanGlazier.png|[[Man on the Moon]] xNathanGlazier.png|[[Take It Back]] {{Nathan Glazier Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Glazier, Nathan}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Cardio)]] [[Category:Patients (Peds)]]

'''Neil Sheridan''' was in the hospital waiting to receive a multi-organ transplant.


At some point in the past, Neil had a bowel resection which led to short gut syndrome. He was on TPN after that, which caused his liver to fail, leaving him in need of a multi-organ transplant, including his small intestine, large intestine, stomach, pancreas, and liver. He twice had transplants not go through.

When Richard came to him to said that there was a set of organs available for him, he was doubtful that it would go through and so didn't ask his family and friends to come to the hospital, because they had come to the two previous surgeries.

There was a snag in the transplant when a tumor was found on the donor liver. However, [[Richard Webber|Richard]] believed that the tumor was benign and wanted to biopsy it to confirm. [[Mark Sloan|Mark]], who was acting as chief for the day, denied the request. In defiance of the request, Richard resected the tumor anyway and the tumor was shown to be benign. After Richard explained the situation to Mark, he allowed the transplant to go on.

Neil woke up post-op and was surprised not to see his loved ones there. [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] reminded him that he asked them not to come, but she suggested that they could call right now.



Neil's family came to his first two transplants, both of which fell through. When a third came up, he didn't call them because he believed it would fall through like the others had. When his surgery was successful and he woke up without anyone there, he was disappointed and immediately called them to come see him.


*He was  at the time of his multi-organ transplant.

'''Nick Kelsey''' is a patient who was injured while skiing off a helicopter.


During one of their adventure field trips, Nick, along with his friends, [[Phil]] and [[Tommy]], planned to ski out of a helicopter. Nick and Phil jumped, but were caught in an avalanche, so Tommy didn't jump. They were taken to the ER, where Nick was found to have a dislocated ankle and fractures to his hip and tibia. He also had frostbite in his fingers. He had fluid around his kidney, so they did a CT. Callie fixed his bones and he had surgery on his kidney.

After his surgery, he was told he'd need six months of physical therapy. [[Callie Torres]] then revealed to Nick and Phil that Tommy didn't enjoy their trips, which led to all of them admitting that they don't need them to keep their blood pumping anymore. So they agreed to go wine tasting in Napa instead of going to run with the bulls in Pamplona.



He's married to a woman named Lainey. When Nick had to have surgery, Tommy called his wife to have her talk to Lainey because she can handle Lainey better.


Nick, [[Phil]], and [[Tommy]] are best friends. They went on several trips to keep their blood pumping, each not realizing that the others didn't need the trips.


He sells insurance.


*He was  at the time of the accident.
*They'd previously climbed Kilimanjaro.

'''Noah Rutstein''' is the father of [[Rhys Rutstein]], a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].


Noah's son, Rhys, was born with a single-ventricle defect and was status  on the heart transplant list after receiving a central shunt, from which he recovered well. His father was informed that he might be able to take Rhys home soon so he could wait at home for a heart transplant. Noah was nervous about taking Rhys home and taking care of him without the doctors and [[Laura Morgan|Laura]] around, but Laura assured him that it was a good thing and he and Rhys would be fine.

However, later that day, Rhys developed congestive heart failure due to his shunt leaking. He was taken into the OR. While in the OR, Rhys's condition worsened to the point where when a heart became available, it was directed to him.



He was married until his wife died in surgery. They had one son together, [[Rhys Rutstein]].


Noah stayed in the NICU with his son, Rhys, while they waited for a heart transplant to come through. When he was told Rhys might be released, he was nervous about being at home alone with Rhys. When Rhys received a heart transplant, he was worried that Rhys would reject the heart.


While in the NICU with his son, Noah developed a friendship with [[Laura Morgan]], whose daughter, Samantha, was also in the hospital. They stayed with each other while the doctors reported on their children, saying it helped to have a second set of ears for all the medical jargon. When they saw [[Stephanie Edwards]] approaching after a call came in from UNOS while Rhys was in surgery, they automatically joined hands. Their relationship was tested when the heart, instead of going to Laura's daughter, went to Noah's son. When Laura saw Noah watching over his son after his heart transplant, she went over to reassure him that Rhys wouldn't reject the heart and placed her hand on top of his.


*He found out his wife died in the surgical waiting area, so he hates being there.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Rutstein, Noah}}

'''Nora''' is the wife of [[Zachary]].


Nora came into the hospital with her husband, Zachary, who had lost his arms four years prior in a logging accident. They were called to the hospital because a donor had finally been located to give Zachary new arms. There was a possible complication when they found a tattoo on one of the arms, but both Nora and Zack said they were okay with it. The first arm was transplanted easily, but the second had a problem. Nora was told they might not be able to transplant the second arm. Her response was that one arm was better than none. However, [[Callie Torres]] was able to restore blood flow and save the arm.

Four weeks after his surgery, Zack had sensation in the tops of his new arms and could move them at the shoulder.



She is married to [[Zachary]]. After he lost his arms in a logging accident, Nora took on the role of caretaker, helping him bathe and shave and get dressed in the morning.

'''Norris Straughn''' came into the hospital with his wife after they escaped a fire in their apartment.


When a fire started in his apartment, Norris grabbed his wife, Hattie, and jumped out the window with her, hoping he would break her fall. When the paramedics arrived, they were unable to find a pulse on Hattie and assumed she was dead, so they tried to get Norris to let her go so they could take him to the hospital, but he refused to let go, forcing them to take both of them in the ambulance on the same gurney. Once they arrived at the hospital, [[Meredith Grey]] talked to Norris, assuring him that he had done everything he could and had held Hattie during the worst part, but that he needed to let her go because he needed to be treated. Once he let go, Hattie was taken onto another gurney so Meredith could declare her dead. However, Meredith found a pulse and the doctors took Hattie to another room to continue to work on her.

Norris had a fracture in his leg and internal injuries. He was taken from the ER into surgery, where Meredith repaired his internal injuries, which included an avulsed spleen, while [[Callie Torres|Callie]] performed a fasciotomy on his leg.

Post-op, Norris and Hattie were reunited. They were both stable. When Hattie found out what Norris had done for her, she said it was stupid.



Norris is married to [[Harriet Straughn]]. He loved her so much that even when he was told that she was dead, he wouldn't let go of her.


Norris and Hattie have one daughter, [[Sarah Straughn|Sarah]]. Sarah is a recovering drug addict who attends Narcotics Anonymous meetings in [[Seattle]].

'''Nova Jenkins''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who had a hippocampectomy to treat her epilepsy.


Nova had epilepsy which was causing seizures that were so frequent that [[Derek Shepherd]] decided to do a hippocampectomy to treat her. With his busy schedule, he kept having to reschedule. When he came into Nova's room one night, her friend, Chelsea, yelled at him, saying that it was cruel to keep rescheduling Nova's surgery because she kept having more seizures and she hadn't eaten in two days. He insisted that the surgery would happen that night, in the middle of the night.

The surgery was performed. While assisting Dr. Shepherd, Leah Murphy made a mistake that could have caused permanent brain damage. After surgery, Nova was reluctant to wake up, but she ultimately opened her eyes and spoke.


She is shy and reserved, which led to Chelsea standing up to Dr. Shepherd for her.



[[Chelsea Ansell]]
Chelsea is Nova's best friend. She came to be with Nova in the hospital before and after her surgery.

'''Officer O'Neil''' is an officer who responded to the hospital lockdown and later fire.


O'Neil was guarding the front entrance of the hospital when the fire caused an explosion. Arizona, Eliza, and Meredith ran to the door, but he stopped them because of the lockdown. Bailey opened the door and said she needed their help, telling him to let them in.

After the staff had been briefed on the fire, O'Neil told Bailey they were still looking for the rapist.

When Ben learned that he'd seen the rapist with Stephanie, he offered to show them where that happened. [[Firefighter Carroll]] said it was too dangerous, but O'Neil thought it was a good idea. While they debated, Ben took a coat and walked into the building. O'Neil and his crew followed.

Inside the building, they found the source of the explosion and found Keith's body on the floor. Ben knew it was too tall to be Stephanie and then he found a blood path that led them up to the roof, where [[Erin Miller|Erin]] and [[Stephanie Edwards|Stephanie]] were.


He works for the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.

'''"Oscar"''' is the nickname [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] gave to the baby found behind the hospital by the dumpsters in a box.



Oscar had heart problems from birth, which led to a failure to thrive. Shane theorized that that's why he was abandoned: his parents thought he was more trouble than he was worth since he'd already had surgery and would need many more.


The expense and stress of his care is likely what led them to abandon him behind the hospital where he was found by [[Jo Wilson]] and [[Stephanie Edwards]].


After being examined at the hospital, it was determined that Oscar had Shone's Complex, which Cristina describes as the trifecta of heart defects. He had had a coarctation to his aorta, which someone had poorly tried to fix, which necessitated Cristina re-opening it. After that procedure, Oscar was discovered to have a mitral valve rupture, so he was taken back into surgery.


The doctors determined that there was no history of Oscar having been born or seen at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] and [[Marilyn Rocher|a social worker]] came to handle his case while they searched for whoever abandoned him.


*The name Oscar comes from Sesame Street, in which Oscar the Grouch lives in a trash can.
